title.narrative: COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATION SPACES - GENDEREQUALITY

description.narrative: Children, adolescents, families and communities participate in the creation of comprehensive education spaces that promote gender equity and safe and protective school environments and contribute to quality education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children and adolescents at the initial, primary and secondary levels and from excluded populations and populations vulnerable to climate change will have access to equitable, quality and pertinent education that effectively prepares them to integrate as active protagonists of their own development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, families and communities participate in the creation of comprehensive education spaces that promote genderequity and safe and protective school environments and contribute to quality education.

description.narrative: In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and the emergencies caused by hurricanes Eta and Iota, UNICEF focused its efforts on socio-emotional support for the educational community, helping to improve the technical skills of coordinators and teachers, and facilitating access to teaching tools for the implementation of psycho-pedagogical playful strategies, aimed at strengthening the resilience of teachers and students in situations of stress and crisis. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
